title: 111_s3860
content: The Secretary of the Army must report on gravesite discrepancies at Arlington National Cemetery within one year of this Act. The report should detail the accuracy of gravesite locations and propose a plan to address any deficiencies. Additionally, the Comptroller General of the United States will review the management and oversight of contracts related to the cemetery. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report to Congress on contracts at Arlington National Cemetery, including details on current contracts over the simplified acquisition threshold and contracts for automation of burial operations. The Comptroller General will report on contracts at Arlington National Cemetery, including management oversight, actions taken, and implementation assessment. An assessment will be conducted on the implementation of Army Directive 2010-04 regarding the Army National Cemeteries Program, including contract management, information systems, organizational structure, and compliance. Additionally, the adequacy of current practices at Arlington National Cemetery will be evaluated, along with recommendations from the Army National Cemeteries Advisory Commission. An assessment will be conducted on the adequacy of current practices at Arlington National Cemetery to provide information, outreach, and support to families of individuals buried there, as well as the feasibility of transferring jurisdiction of the cemetery to the Department of Veterans Affairs. The term "simplified acquisition threshold" is defined in the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act. Specified committees of Congress include the Committee on Armed Services, Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs, Veterans' Affairs in the Senate, and the Committee on Armed Services, Oversight and Government Reform, Veterans' Affairs in the House of Representatives. The Secretary of the Army is required to submit reports to Congress on the implementation of Army Directive 2010-04 on Enhancing the Operations. The Secretary of the Army must report to Congress on compliance with Army Directive 2010-04 for Arlington National Cemetery, including contract management, technology systems, organizational structure, and outreach practices. The Secretary of the Army must report to Congress on compliance with Army Directive 2010-04 for Arlington National Cemetery, including contract management, technology systems, organizational structure, and outreach practices. The report should provide information, outreach, and support to families of those buried at Arlington National Cemetery regarding procedures to detect and correct errors in burials. Reports are due 270 days after the enactment of this Act, and annually for the next 2 years.
